definitions.text: 16 ounces avoirdupois
examples: he got a hernia when he tried to lift 100 pounds

definitions.text: the basic unit of money in Great Britain and Northern Ireland; equal to 100 pence
a unit of apothecary weight equal to 12 ounces troy
the basic unit of money in Syria; equal to 100 piasters
the basic unit of money in the Sudan; equal to 100 piasters
the basic unit of money in Lebanon; equal to 100 piasters
formerly the basic unit of money in Ireland; equal to 100 pence
the basic unit of money in Egypt; equal to 100 piasters
the basic unit of money in Cyprus; equal to 100 cents
a nontechnical unit of force equal to the mass of 1 pound with an acceleration of free fall equal to 32 feet/sec/sec
United States writer who lived in Europe; strongly influenced the development of modern literature (1885-1972)
a symbol for a unit of currency (especially for the pound sterling in Great Britain)
a public enclosure for stray or unlicensed dogs
examples: unlicensed dogs will be taken to the pound

definitions.text: the act of pounding (delivering repeated heavy blows)
examples: the sudden hammer of fists caught him off guard
the pounding of feet on the hallway

definitions.text: hit hard with the hand, fist, or some heavy instrument
examples: the salesman pounded the door knocker

definitions.text: strike or drive against with a heavy impact
examples: ram the gate with a sledgehammer

definitions.text: move heavily or clumsily
examples: The heavy man lumbered across the room

definitions.text: move rhythmically
partition off into compartments
examples: The locks pound the water of the canal

definitions.text: shut up or confine in any enclosure or within any bounds or limits
place or shut up in a pound
examples: pound the cows so they don't stray

definitions.text: break down and crush by beating, as with a pestle
examples: pound the roots with a heavy flat stone
